Obviously, you are not familiar with the Supreme Court ruling in Department of the Navy vs. Egan (1988).  They found that the president in his role as commander in chief is above, beyond, and not in any way bound by the information classification process.  Whatever procedure he uses (or none) is de facto appropriate because the Constitution places the responsibility for national defense with the president.  Classification occurs because he has established it but he is not bound by it.

You're still hung up on "authority to declassify."
